Zooming (IF Statements)

IF-statements may involve multiple (>2) bifurcations of the flow and we may not want all of them to show up. This can be implemented with zooming options.

representation in the diagram

When the action(s) in any of the conditional paths is(are) assigned a lower zoom level (lower than the overall zoom level), via the $1,2,... option, that conditional path will not be displayed immediately. Instead, the bifurcation diamond will have a hyperlink with an icon such as ‘[...]’. A mouse double-click will show the paths corresponding to the next (lower) level of zoom. A mouse double-click on the bifurcation diamond, again, will hide those paths.

Secondarily, the options $1,2,... in the comments specifying the user-defined conditionStatements will have the same operational effect.
Note: they are overridden by the zoom level of the actions inside the path, if there is conflict.
